intro: Rhinanthus intermedius, commonly known as the common yellow-rattle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic relationships with grasses. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom from June to August. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it plays a role in maintaining biodiversity in grassland ecosystems.
